metadata.title: CVE-2022-32250 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - high
metadata.description:
net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c in the Linux kernel through 5.18.1 allows alocal user (able to create user/net namespaces) to escalate privileges toroot because an incorrect NFT_STATEFUL_EXPR check leads to ause-after-free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32250` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 5.19.0-15.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 5.19.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 5.19.0-1001.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-15.15').
